alert.note: Alert for Clay; Marshall; Riley (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 20 at 2:37AM CDT until April 20 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Urban and Small Stream Flood Advisory for... Northwestern Riley County in northeastern Kansas... Northwestern Nemaha County in northeastern Kansas... Northeastern Clay County in north central Kansas... Southeastern Washington County in north central Kansas... Marshall County in northeastern Kansas... * Until 530 AM CDT. * At 236 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding in the advisory area. Two to three inches of rain have already fallen. An additional one to two inches of rain is possible. * Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marysville, Blue Rapids, Frankfort, Waterville, Axtell, Greenleaf, Beattie, Barnes, Summerfield and Palmer.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
